intro: Myriophyllum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican watermilfoil, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species, typically found in freshwater environments such as lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, whorled leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are tiny and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, usually appearing in late summer. Myriophyllum mexicanum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
